## Notes on compression 

To avoid this problem

```
[~/projects/classic-problems-python/chap1-small-problems/Compression] # python3 trivial_compression.py
  File "trivial_compression.py", line 6
    self.bit_string: int = 1  # start with sentinel
                   ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```

you'll need to install python3.9 (e.g. for Ubuntu 16.04 I used http://ubuntuhandbook.org/index.php/2020/10/python-3-9-0-released-install-ppa-ubuntu/)

```
[~/projects/classic-problems-python/chap1-small-problems/Compression] # python3.9 trivial_compression.py
original is 909 bytes
compressed is 256 bytes

original and decompressed are the same: True
```

```
[~/projects/classic-problems-python/chap1-small-problems/Compression] # python3.9 trivial_compression.py
original is 307 bytes
compressed is 96 bytes
TAGGGATTAACCGTTATATATATATAGCCATGGATCGATTATATAGGGATTAACCGTTATATATATATAGCCATGGATCGATTATATAGGGATTAACCGTTATATATATATAGCCATGGATCGATTATATAGGGATTAACCGTTATATATATATAGCCATGGATCGATTATATAGGGATTAACCGTTATATATATATAGCCATGGATCGATTATATAGGGATTAACCGTTATATATATATAGCCATGGATCGATTATA
original and decompressed are the same: True
```

the longer the test string (and real DNA strings are very long), the closer we get to the expected 75% space savings:

```
[~/projects/classic-problems-python/chap1-small-problems/Compression] # echo 'scale=2;100*256/909'|bc
28.16
[~/projects/classic-problems-python/chap1-small-problems/Compression] # echo 'scale=2;100*96/307'|bc
31.27
```
